times new roman">President, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, 
Secretary and Director</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">Paul Andy Ruppanner<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">:</font></font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">Mr. Ruppanner is the Managing Director of Company Builders LLC,
an operationally oriented consultancy focused on building strategically 
successful, sustainable businesses.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">His experience includes senior executive assignments in both 
large and entrepreneurial companies. At IBM, Ruppanner&#8217;s assignments 
included executive management of sales and service organizations as well as 
executive leadership positions in IBM&#8217;s management development program, 
service planning and support of manufacturing and development and
division/company starter. After IBM, he joined Office Depot as a Vice President 
to successfully develop a new technology division, now operating internationally
as Tech Depot. Mr. Ruppanner holds an MBA from Emory University in Atlanta, 
Georgia and resides in Santa Fe, New Mexico with his family.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">27</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">CODE OF ETHICS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">The Company has not&#160;&#160;formally&#160;&#160;adopted a 
written&#160;&#160;code of ethics that applies to 
the&#160;&#160;Company's&#160;&#160;principal&#160;&#160;executive&#160;&#160;of
ficer,&#160;&#160;principal&#160;&#160;financial&#160;&#160;officer or 
controller, or persons performing&#160;&#160;similar functions.&#160;&#160;Based
on our small size, early development&#160;&#160;stage and 
limited&#160;&#160;financial and human resources,&#160;&#160;we did not 
believe&#160;&#160;that normally&#160;&#160;adopting a written&#160;&#160;code 
of ethics&#160;&#160;would&#160;&#160;benefit&#160;&#160;the 
shareholders.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">At this time the Company does not have a policy that it&#8217;s
directors or a majority be independent of management as the Company has at this
time only one directors. It is the intention of the Company to implement a 
policy that a majority of the Board member be independent of the Company&#8217;s
management as the member&#8217;s of the board of director&#8217;s increases. A 
Director is considered independent if the Board affirmatively determines that 
the Director (or an immediate family member) does not have any direct or 
indirect material relationship with the Company or its affiliates or any member 
of senior management of the Company or his or her affiliates. The term 
&#8220;affiliate&#8221; means any corporation or other entity that controls, is 
controlled by, or under common control with the Company, evidenced by the power 
to elect a majority of the Board of Directors or comparable governing body of 
such entity. The term &#8220;immediate family member&#8221; means spouse, 
parents, children, siblings, mothers- and fathers-in-law, sons- and daughters-in
law, brothers- and sisters-in-laws and anyone (other than domestic employees) 
sharing the Director&#8217;s home.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">COMMITTEES</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">We do not have audit, nominating, or compensation committees or
committees performing similar functions nor a written nominating, compensation 
of audit committee charter. Our Board of Directors as a whole decides such 
matters, including those that would be performed by a standing nominating 
committee. Our Board of Directors has not adopted any processes or procedures 
for considering executive and director compensation. <font style="DISPLAY: 
inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>We have not yet adopted an audit, 
compensation, or nominating committees because we have not sufficiently 
developed our operations and have generated no revenues since we changed our 
business model to development satage activities.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">Additionally, we do not currently have any specific or minimum 
criteria for the election of nominees to our Board of Directors nor do we have 
any process or procedure for evaluating such nominees.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">SHAREHOLDER COMMUNICATIONS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">Our Board of Directors does not have any defined policy or 
procedure requirements for our stockholders to send communications to our Board 
of Directors, including submission of recommendations for nominating 
directors.&#160;We have not yet adopted a process for our security holders to 
communicate with our Board of Directors because we have not sufficiently
developed our operations and corporate governance structure. We however invite 
any shareholders to contact us at the corporate address and telephone 
number,</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">28</font></div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">BOARD OF DIRECTOR MEETINGS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">No formal Board of Directors meetings were called during the 
year ended March 31, 2013. The Board of Directors which is comprised of one 
individual performs it meeting functions on specific matters by calling special 
meetings on an as required basis to deal with matters that requires Board 
action.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">ANNUAL SHAREHOLDER MEETINGS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;</font><br>
&#160;</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">We have not yet held an annual shareholders 
meeting.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">LEGAL MATTERS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">None of our officers, directors, or persons nominated for such 
position, has been involved in legal proceedings that would be material to an 
evaluation of their ability or integrity, including:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="3%">

Times New Roman">&#183; &#160;</font></div>
</td>

Times New Roman">involvement in any bankruptcy;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

Times New Roman">&#183; &#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="97%">

proceeding;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#183; &#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="97%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">being subject to a pending criminal proceeding;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#183; &#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="97%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">being subject to any order or judgment, decree permanently or
temporarily enjoining barring, suspending or otherwise limiting their 
involvement in any type of business, securities or banking activities; 
and</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="3%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#183; &#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="97%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">being found by a court of competent jurisdiction (in a civil 
action), the SEC or the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to have violated a 
federal or state securities or commodities law, and the judgment has not been 
reversed, suspended, or vacated.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">COMPLIANCE WITH SECTION 16(a) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act, as amended, 
requires&#160;&#160;that our&#160;&#160;directors, 
executive&#160;&#160;officers&#160;&#160;and&#160;&#160;persons who own more 
than 10% of a class of our equity 
securities&#160;&#160;which&#160;&#160;are&#160;&#160;registered&#160;&#160;unde
r&#160;&#160;the&#160;&#160;Exchange&#160;&#160;Act to 
file&#160;&#160;with&#160;&#160;the 
Commission&#160;&#160;initial&#160;&#160;reports of ownership and reports of 
changes of ownership of such registered securities.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">To our knowledge, based solely on a review of copies of such 
reports, no person required to file such a report failed to file a required 
report with respect to the fiscal year covered by this report.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">ITEM 10: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

Times New Roman">ITEM 11: SECURITY OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND 
MANAGEMENT</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>

Times New Roman">The following table presents certain information regarding the 
beneficial ownership of all shares of common stock at the date of this filing 
for each executive officer and director of our Company and for each person known
to us who owns beneficially more than five percent (5%) of the outstanding 
shares of our common stock. The percentage ownership shown in such table is 
based upon the 47,100,060 common shares issued and outstanding.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">ITEM 12: CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED 
TRANSACTIONS</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">Our management is involved in 
other&#160;&#160;business&#160;&#160;activities and may, in the future 
become&#160;&#160;involved&#160;&#160;in&#160;&#160;other&#160;&#160;business&#1
60;&#160;opportunities.&#160;&#160;If&#160;&#160;a&#160;&#160;specific&#160;&#16
0;business 
opportunity&#160;&#160;becomes&#160;&#160;available,&#160;&#160;such&#160;&#160;
persons may face a conflict in selecting between our business&#160;&#160;and 
their other&#160;&#160;business&#160;&#160;interests.&#160;&#160;In the event 
that a conflict of interest&#160;&#160;arises at a meeting of 
our&#160;&#160;directors,&#160;&#160;a director who has such a 
conflict&#160;&#160;will disclose his interest in a 
proposed&#160;&#160;transaction&#160;&#160;and will abstain from voting for or 
against the approval of such transaction.</font></div>

fees&#160;&#160;related&#160;&#160;to&#160;&#160;professional&#160;&#160;service
s&#160;&#160;rendered&#160;&#160;in connection&#160;&#160;with the audit of our 
annual&#160;&#160;financial&#160;&#160;statements.&#160;&#160;All other fees 
relate to professional&#160;&#160;services&#160;&#160;rendered in connection 
with the review of the quarterly financial statements.</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Insomuch as we 
do not have an audit committee,&#160;&#160;our board of 
directors&#160;&#160;performs the functions of an audit 
committee.&#160;&#160;Section 10A(i) of the Securities&#160;&#160;Exchange Act 
of 1934 prohibits our auditors from performing audit services for us as well as 
any services not considered to be "audit&#160;&#160;services"&#160;&#160;unless 
such services are pre-approved&#160;&#160;by the&#160;&#160;board 
of&#160;&#160;directors&#160;&#160;(in lieu of the 
audit&#160;&#160;committee)&#160;&#160;or unless the services meet certain de 
minimis standards</font>.</font></div>
<br>
<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-
RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

Times New Roman">SIGNATURES</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:

Securities&#160;&#160;Exchange Act of 
1934,the&#160;&#160;Registrant&#160;&#160;has 
duly&#160;&#160;caused&#160;&#160;this report to be signed on its behalf by the 
undersigned, thereunto duly authorized.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Exhibit 31.1</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman">CERTIFICATION</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">June 28, 2013</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">I, Andy Ruppanner, certify that:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of TOA 
Distribution Systems Inc.;</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">1.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue 
statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make 
the statements</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">made, in light of the&#160;&#160;circumstances&#160;&#160;under
which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period 
covered by this report;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">2.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">Based&#160;&#160;on 
my&#160;&#160;knowledge,&#160;&#160;the&#160;&#160;financial&#160;&#160;statemen
ts,&#160;&#160;and&#160;&#160;other&#160;&#160;financial 
information&#160;&#160;included&#160;&#160;in this 
annual&#160;&#160;report,&#160;&#160;fairly&#160;&#160;present in 
all&#160;&#160;material respects the 
financial&#160;&#160;condition,&#160;&#160;results of operations&#160;&#160;and 
cash flows of the issuer as of, and for, the periods presented in this 
report;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">3.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">The issuer's other certifying&#160;&#160;officer and I are 
responsible for establishing and 
maintaining&#160;&#160;disclosure&#160;&#160;controls and procedures (as defined
in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the issuer and 
have:</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">4. (a) 
Designed&#160;&#160;such&#160;&#160;disclosure&#160;&#160;controls&#160;&#160;an
d&#160;&#160;procedures,&#160;&#160;or&#160;&#160;caused&#160;&#160;such 
disclosure&#160;&#160;controls and&#160;&#160;procedures to be 
designed&#160;&#160;under our&#160;&#160;supervision,&#160;&#160;to 
ensure&#160;&#160;that&#160;&#160;material&#160;&#160;information&#160;&#160;rel
ating&#160;&#160;to&#160;&#160;the&#160;&#160;issuer,&#160;&#160;&#160;including
&#160;&#160;its consolidated subsidiaries,&#160;&#160;is made known to us by 
others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this 
report is being prepared;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(b) Evaluated 
the&#160;&#160;effectiveness&#160;&#160;of the 
issuer's&#160;&#160;disclosure&#160;&#160;controls and procedures and presented 
in this report our conclusions&#160;&#160;about the effectiveness of the 
disclosure&#160;&#160;controls and procedures,&#160;&#160;as of the end of the 
period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(c) Disclosed in this report any 
change in the issuer's&#160;&#160;internal&#160;&#160;control&#160;&#160;over 
financial&#160;&#160;reporting that occurred&#160;&#160;during the period 
covered by the annual report that 
has&#160;&#160;materially&#160;&#160;affected,&#160;&#160;or 
is&#160;&#160;reasonably&#160;&#160;likely to&#160;&#160;materially affect, the 
issuer's internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">5.</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:
Times New Roman">The issuer's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, 
based on our most recent&#160;&#160;evaluation of internal&#160;&#160;control 
over&#160;&#160;financial&#160;&#160;reporting,&#160;&#160;to the issuer's 
auditors and the audit committee of the issuer's board of directors (or persons 
performing the equivalent functions):</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(a) All 
significant&#160;&#160;deficiencies and material&#160;&#160;weaknesses in the 
design or operation of internal&#160;&#160;control 
over&#160;&#160;financial&#160;&#160;reporting&#160;&#160;which 
are&#160;&#160;reasonably likely to adversely&#160;&#160;affect the issuer's 
ability to record,&#160;&#160;process,&#160;&#160;summarize and report financial
information; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(b) Any fraud, whether or not 
material,&#160;&#160;that involves management or other employees&#160;&#160;who
have a&#160;&#160;significant&#160;&#160;role in the 
issuer's&#160;&#160;internal&#160;&#160;control over financial 
reporting.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div align="center">
<table bgcolor="white" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-

10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: 
italic">/s/ Andy Ruppanner</font></font></td>
<td width="46%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:

0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:

0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">&#160;</font></div>

0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: 
Times New Roman">In connection with the accompanying Annual Report on Form 10-K 
of TOA Distribution Systems Inc for the&#160;Year Ended March 31, 2013, I, Andy 
Ruppanner, President and Chief&#160;Executive Officer of TOA Distribution 
Systems Inc hereby certify pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted 
pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, to the best of my 
knowledge and belief, that:</font></div>
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY:

    <us-gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock 
contextRef="From2012-04-01to2013-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 1.&amp;#9;BASIS OF 
PRESENTATION&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In August 2009 the 
Company initiated a number&#13;of corporate changes, including 1), a name change
to TOA Distribution Systems Inc, (formerly known as Skyhigh Resources Inc, 
2)&#13;approved a 10 for 1 roll forward of its issued and outstanding common 
stock, 3), increased it authorized par value $0.001 common&#13;shares to 
250,000,000 shares (formerly 50,000,000), and 4), authorized 10,000,000 par 
value $0.001 preferred shares.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company also 
resolved to change its corporate focus, moving&#13;from mining and exploration 
into bottled drinking water distribution.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 5pt 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On 
September 2, 2009 the Company entered&#13;into to a Sub-Distribution agreement 
with Taste of Aruba (US), Inc to distribute bottled water products produced in 
Aruba by Taste&#13;of Aruba-Premium Aruban Water. The territory in which the 
Company can distribute these products include the United States and&#13;all its 
territories and insular areas in the Caribbean and Pacific such as but not 
limited to Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands,&#13;Marshall Islands, and Guam, and
all of Canada.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 5pt 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The water product is made 
from desalinated seawater, is filtered through coral calcium&#13;and will be 
further enhanced by the addition of electrolytes then bottled in Taste of 
Aruba&amp;#146;s proprietary biodegradable bottles.&#13;The products will be 
marketed to retail locations that currently handle bottled water such as display
cases in food beverage marketer&#13;at airports, food chain store, and 
sublicensing to bulk dealers and will include the use of vending machines 
located at high traffic&#13;locations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company currently 
owns two (2) mineral&#13;properties, which were acquired by issuing stock to 
related parties and which have been fully impaired on acquisition. These 
claims&#13;are deemed surplus and have been for sale for approximately two 
years.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;It is management&amp;#146;s opinion that &lt;font style="color: 
black"&gt;all&#13;adjustments necessary for a fair statement of the results for 
this interim period have been made and all adjustments made are of&#13;a normal 
recurring nature.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2012-04-
01to2013-03-31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 2.&amp;#9;SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT 
ACCOUNTING&#13;POLICIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/50%
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;This
summary of significant accounting&#13;policies is presented to assist in
understanding the Company&amp;#146;s financial statements. The financial 
statements and notes are&#13;representations of the Company&amp;#146;s 
management who is responsible for their integrity and objectivity. 
&amp;#160;These accounting&#13;policies conform to generally accepted accounting
principles in the United States of America and have been consistently 
applied&#13;in the preparation of the financial statements. &amp;#160;The 
financial statements are stated in United States of America 
dollars.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;a)&amp;#9;Organizational and Start-up Costs&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Costs of start-up 
activities, including organizational costs, are expensed as incurred in 
accordance with ASC 720-15.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;b)&amp;#9;Income 
Taxes&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 11pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-weight: normal"&gt;The Company has adopted the 
Statement&#13;of Financial Accounting Standards No. 109 &amp;#150; 
&amp;#147;Accounting for Income Taxes&amp;#148; (ASC 740). &amp;#160;ASC 740 
requires the&#13;use of the asset and liability method of accounting of income 
taxes. &amp;#160;Under the asset and liability method of ASC 740, 
deferred&#13;tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax 
consequences attributable to temporary differences between the 
financial&#13;statements carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and
their respective tax bases. &amp;#160;Deferred tax assets and 
liabilities&#13;are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to 
taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences 
are&#13;expected to be recovered or 
settled.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font-weight: 
normal"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;c)&amp;#9;Basic and 
Diluted Loss Per Share&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;In accordance with ASC 
260 &amp;#150; &amp;#147;Earnings&#13;Per Share&amp;#148;, the basic loss per 
common share is computed by dividing net loss available to common stockholders 
by the weighted&#13;average number of common shares 
outstanding.&amp;#160;Diluted loss per common share is computed similar to basic
loss per common share&#13;except that the denominator is increased to include 
the number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding 
if&#13;the potential common shares had been issued and if the additional common 
shares were dilative. &amp;#160;At March 31, 2013 the Company&#13;had no stock 
equivalents that were anti-dilutive and excluded in the earnings per share 
computation.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;d)&amp;#9;Estimated Fair Value of 
Financial Instruments&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The carrying value of 
the Company&amp;#146;s financial&#13;instruments, consisting of accounts payable
and accrued liabilities approximate their fair value due to the short-term 
maturity&#13;of such instruments. &amp;#160;Unless otherwise noted, it is 
management&amp;#146;s opinion that the Company is not exposed to 
significant&#13;interest, currency or credit risks arising from these financial 
statements.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;e)&amp;#9;Revenue Recognition&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The company has had no 
revenues to date. It&#13;is the Company&amp;#146;s policy that revenues will be 
recognized in accordance with SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin (SAB) No. 
104,&#13;&amp;#34;Revenue Recognition.&amp;#34; &amp;#160;Under SAB 104, product
revenues (or service revenues) are recognized when persuasive evidence&#13;of an
arrangement exists, delivery has occurred (or service has been performed), the 
sales price is fixed and determinable and&#13;collectability is reasonably 
assured.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;f)&amp;#9;Currency&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The functional currency 
of the Company is the&#13;United States Dollar.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;g)&amp;#9;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The preparation of the Company&amp;#146;s financial&#13;statements 
in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles requires management 
to make estimates and assumptions that&#13;affect the amounts reported in these 
financial statements and accompanying notes. &amp;#160;Actual results could 
differ from those&#13;estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;h)&amp;#9;Cash and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company considers all highly liquid debt&#13;instruments with an
original maturity of three months or less to be cash 
equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;i)&amp;#9;Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;Earnings (loss) per 
share of common stock are&#13;computed by dividing the net earnings (loss) by 
the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the period. 
Diluted&#13;earnings per share are not shown for periods in which the Company 
incurs a loss because it would be anti-dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;j) &amp;#9;Advertising 
Costs&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
Company&amp;#146;s policy regarding advertising is to expense 
advertising&#13;when incurred. The Company had not incurred any advertising 
expense as of March 31, 2013.&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;k)&amp;#9;Other&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:
 justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;The Company consists of one reportable business 
segment. The Company paid no&#13;dividends during the periods from inception 
April 2, 2007 to March 31, 2013.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <TOA:GoingConcernTextBlock contextRef="From2012-04-01to2013-03-31">&lt;p 
style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 
3.&amp;#9;GOING CONCERN&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;The accompanying 
financial statements have&#13;been prepared in conformity with generally 
accepted accounting principles (GAAP) in the United States of America, which 
contemplates&#13;continuation of the Company as a going concern. 
&amp;#160;However, the Company has no business operations to date, accumulated 
losses&#13;amounting to $174,647 and must secure additional financing to 
commence the Company&amp;#146;s plan of operations, which means there&#13;is 
substantial concern about the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a going 
concern. &amp;#160;The Company intends to acquire additional&#13;operating 
capital through equity offerings to the public to fund its business plan or 
loans from shareholders and others. There&#13;is no assurance that the equity 
offerings will be successful or loans will be received to provide sufficient 
funds to commence&#13;operations or to assure the eventual profitability of the 
Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</TOA:GoingConcernTextBlock>

ock contextRef="From2012-04-01to2013-03-31">&lt;p style="margin:

    <TOA:SubdistributionAgreementTextBlock contextRef="From2012-04-01to2013-03-
31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 
5.&amp;#9;SUB-DISTRIBUTION AGREEMENT&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;On September 2, 2009 the
Company signed an&#13;Exclusive Sub-Distribution Agreement 
(&amp;#147;Agreement&amp;#148;) with Taste of Aruba (US) Inc, a State of Nevada 
Incorporated company,&#13;owner and master distributor of products from Taste of
Aruba-Premium Aruban Water. Under the Agreement, the Company will 
distribute&#13;in the United States, its territories and insular areas in the 
Caribbean and Pacific and Canada, bottled water produced under&#13;license in 
Aruba by Water Energy Company-Aruba. To maintain the Agreement, the Company will
be required to meet certain product&#13;sales volumes after Taste of Aruba 
commences production. The start of production by Taste of Aruba had been delayed
due to it&#13;inability to complete funding arrangements which is now reported 
to be eminent. If Taste of Aruba receives funding as projected,&#13;the 
production facility is expected to be complete by November 2013. Payment for the
Agreement cost of $42,500, which was fully&#13;impaired on acquisition, was paid
by the issuance of 17,000,000 post dividend shares of the Company&amp;#146;s
common restricted stock&#13;issued in accordance with ASC 505-50-30-6 at $0.025 
per share.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;T&lt;font style="color: black"&gt;he Company 
periodically&#13;reviews for impairment its long-lived assets whenever events or
changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an&#13;asset may 
not be recoverable. Management has determined that its Distribution Agreement 
asset requires impairment. As no sale activities&#13;have occurred, no product 
is yet available for sale and funds to establish a sales and distribution 
operation have not been secured.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</TOA:SubdistributionAgreementTextBlock>

retroactively to account for the forward stock

8.&amp;#9;CONTRIBUTED SURPLUS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;The Company owned two (2) mineral claims that had been deemed surplus 
and fully&#13;impaired. On to May 1, 2012 these claims were sold to a related 
party to whom the Company had loans payable. The terms of the&#13;sale was a 
reduction of the loans payable and proportionate accrued interest in aggregate 
amounting to Twenty-Five Thousand Dollar,&#13;($25,000.00), an extension on the 
due date of the loan to November 13, 2013, a reduction of the rate of interest 
payable to 5%&#13;and the issuance by the purchaser of shares in two private 
companies. These shares were valued by the Company at $0 value 
therefore&#13;there was no impact on the financial statements. The Company 
distributed the shares equally to each of the shareholders of 
the&#13;Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</TOA:ContributedSurplusTextBlock>

9.&amp;#9;SUBSEQUENT EVENTS&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;The 
Company has evaluated subsequent&#13;events through the date that the financial 
statements were issued. There were no significant subsequent events that need to
be&#13;disclosed.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 11pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;EVALUATION OF 
DISCLOSURE CONTROLS&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
11pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;As of the end&#13;of the period covered by this 
report, we conducted an evaluation, under the supervision and with the 
participation of our chief&#13;executive officer and chief financial officer, of
our disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rule 13a-15(e) of 
the&#13;Exchange Act). Based upon this evaluation, our chief executive officer 
and chief financial officer concluded that our disclosure&#13;controls and 
procedures are ineffective to ensure that information required to be disclosed 
by us in the reports that we file&#13;or submit under the Exchange Act is 
recorded, processed, summarized and reported, within the time periods specified 
in the Security&#13;and Exchange Commission's rules and 
forms.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;There has been&#13;no change in our internal control 
over financial reporting during the current quarter that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably&#13;likely to materially affect, our internal control
over financial reporting.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
11pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;EVALUATION OF AND REPORT ON 
INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
11pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;Our management&#13;is responsible for establishing and maintaining 
adequate internal control over financial reporting for the company. Internal 
control&#13;over financial reporting is to provide reasonable assurance 
regarding the reliability of our financial reporting purposes 
accordance&#13;with accounting principles generally accepted in the United 
States of America. Internal control over financial reporting 
includes&#13;maintaining records that in reasonable detail accurately and fairly
reflect our transaction; providing reasonable assurance that&#13;transactions 
are recorded as necessary for preparations of our financial statements; 
providing reasonable assurance that receipts&#13;and expenditures of company 
assets are made in accordance with management authorization; and providing 
reasonable assurance that&#13;unauthorized acquisitions, use or disposition of 
company assets that could have a material effect on our financial 
statements&#13;would be prevented or 
detected.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 11pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;Management conducted&#13;an evaluation of the 
effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting based on the 
framework in Internal Control&#13;&amp;#150; Integrated Framework issued by the 
Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission. Based on this 
evaluation&#13;management concluded that the Company's internal control over 
financial reporting was ineffective as of March 31, 2013. There&#13;where no 
changes in our internal control over financial reporting during the period ended
March 31, 2013 that have materially&#13;affected, or are reasonable likely to 
materially affect, or are reasonably likely to material affect, our internal 
control over&#13;financial 
reporting.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>

&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 2.&amp;#9;SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING
POLICIES&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/50% Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;This summary of significant accounting
policies is presented to assist in understanding the Company&amp;#146;s 
financial statements. The financial statements and notes are
representations of the Company&amp;#146;s management who is responsible for 
their integrity and objectivity. &amp;#160;These accounting
policies conform to generally accepted accounting principles in the United 
States of America and have been consistently applied
in the preparation of the financial statements. &amp;#160;The financial 
statements are stated in United States of America dollars.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;a)&amp;#9;Organizational and Start-up Costs&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;Costs of start-up activities, including organizational costs,
are expensed as incurred in accordance with ASC 720-15.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;b)&amp;#9;Income Taxes&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;font style="font-weight: normal"&gt;The Company has adopted the 
Statement
of Financial Accounting Standards No. 109 &amp;#150; &amp;#147;Accounting for 
Income Taxes&amp;#148; (ASC 740). &amp;#160;ASC 740 requires the
use of the asset and liability method of accounting of income taxes. 
&amp;#160;Under the asset and liability method of ASC 740, deferred
tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences 
attributable to temporary differences between the financial
statements carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their 
respective tax bases. &amp;#160;Deferred tax assets and liabilities
are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the 
years in which those temporary differences are
expected to be recovered or settled.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 11pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-weight: normal"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;c)&amp;#9;Basic and Diluted Loss Per Share&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt/12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-
align: justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;In accordance with ASC 260 &amp;#150; &amp;#147;Earnings
Per Share&amp;#148;, the basic loss per common share is computed by dividing net
loss available to common stockholders by the weighted
average number of common shares outstanding.&amp;#160;Diluted loss per common 
share is computed similar to basic loss per common share
except that the denominator is increased to include the number of additional 
common shares that would have been outstanding if
the potential common shares had been issued and if the additional common shares 
were dilative. &amp;#160;At March 31, 2013 the Company
had no stock equivalents that were anti-dilutive and excluded in the earnings 
per share computation.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;d)&amp;#9;Estimated Fair Value of Financial Instruments&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The carrying value of the Company&amp;#146;s financial
instruments, consisting of accounts payable and accrued liabilities approximate
their fair value due to the short-term maturity
of such instruments. &amp;#160;Unless otherwise noted, it is 
management&amp;#146;s opinion that the Company is not exposed to significant
interest, currency or credit risks arising from these financial 
statements.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;e)&amp;#9;Revenue Recognition&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The company has had no revenues to date. It
is the Company&amp;#146;s policy that revenues will be recognized in accordance 
with SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin (SAB) No. 104,
&amp;#34;Revenue Recognition.&amp;#34; &amp;#160;Under SAB 104, product revenues
(or service revenues) are recognized when persuasive evidence
of an arrangement exists, delivery has occurred (or service has been performed),
the sales price is fixed and determinable and
collectability is reasonably assured.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;f)&amp;#9;Currency&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The functional currency of the Company is the
United States Dollar.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;g)&amp;#9;Use of Estimates&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The preparation of the Company&amp;#146;s financial
statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles requires 
management to make estimates and assumptions that
affect the amounts reported in these financial statements and accompanying 
notes. &amp;#160;Actual results could differ from those
estimates.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;h)&amp;#9;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The Company considers all highly liquid debt
instruments with an original maturity of three months or less to be cash 
equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;i)&amp;#9;Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;Earnings (loss) per share of common stock are
computed by dividing the net earnings (loss) by the weighted average number of 
common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted
earnings per share are not shown for periods in which the Company incurs a loss 
because it would be anti-dilutive.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;j) &amp;#9;Advertising Costs&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
Company&amp;#146;s policy regarding advertising is to expense advertising
when incurred. The Company had not incurred any advertising expense as of March 
31, 2013.&lt;br /&gt;
&lt;br /&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;k)&amp;#9;Other&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt"&gt;The Company 
consists of one reportable business segment. The Company paid no
dividends during the periods from inception April 2, 2007 to March 31, 
2013.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer

        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The aggregate total of expenses of managing and administering
the affairs of an entity, including affiliates of the reporting entity, which 
are not directly or indirectly associated with the manufacture, sale or creation
of a product or product line.</p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_IncomeLossFromContinuingOperations">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Amount of income (loss) from continuing operations 
attributable to the parent. Also defined as revenue less expenses and taxes from
ongoing operations before extraordinary items but after deduction of those 
portions of income or loss from continuing operations that are allocable to 
noncontrolling interests.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display:

                    <td>xbrli:stringItemType</td>
                  </tr>

                    <td>na</td>
                  </tr>

                    <td>duration</td>

                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
          </td>
        </tr>

        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Interest expense on all other items not previously 
classified. For example, includes dividends associated with redeemable preferred
stock of a subsidiary that is treated as a liability in the parent's 
consolidated balance sheet.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"><b>NOTE 4.&#9;RECENT ACCOUNTING PRONOUNCEMENTS
</b></p>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">The Company has evaluated the recent accounting
pronouncements and believes that none of these will have a material effect on 
the company&#146;s financial statements.</p>
<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify">&#160;</p>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>15
<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
/**
 * Rivet Software Inc.
 *
 * @copyright Copyright (c) 2006-2011 Rivet Software, Inc. All rights reserved.
 * Version 2.4.0.3
 *
 */
var Show = {};
Show.LastAR = null,
Show.hideAR = function(){
Show.LastAR.style.display = 'none';
};
Show.showAR = function ( link, id, win ){
if( Show.LastAR ){
Show.hideAR();
}
var ref = link;
do {
ref = ref.nextSibling;
} while (ref && ref.nodeName != 'TABLE');
if (!ref || ref.nodeName != 'TABLE') {
var tmp = win ?
win.document.getElementById(id) :
document.getElementById(id);
if( tmp ){
ref = tmp.cloneNode(true);
ref.id = '';
link.parentNode.appendChild(ref);
}
}
if( ref ){
ref.style.display = 'block';
Show.LastAR = ref;
}
};
Show.toggleNext = function( link ){
var ref = link;
do{
ref = ref.nextSibling;
}while( ref.nodeName != 'DIV' );
if( ref.style &&
ref.style.display &&
ref.style.display == 'none' ){
ref.style.display = 'block';
if( link.textContent ){
link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '+', '-' );
}else{
link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '+', '-' );
}
}else{
ref.style.display = 'none';
if( link.textContent ){
link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '-', '+' );
}else{
link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '-', '+' );
}
}
};
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;NOTE 3.&amp;#9;GOING CONCERN&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;The accompanying financial statements have
been prepared in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP)
in the United States of America, which contemplates
continuation of the Company as a going concern. &amp;#160;However, the Company 
has no business operations to date, accumulated losses
amounting to $174,647 and must secure additional financing to commence the 
Company&amp;#146;s plan of operations, which means there
is substantial concern about the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue as a 
going concern. &amp;#160;The Company intends to acquire additional
operating capital through equity offerings to the public to fund its business 
plan or loans from shareholders and others. There
is no assurance that the equity offerings will be successful or loans will be 
received to provide sufficient funds to commence
operations or to assure the eventual profitability of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer

justify"&gt;Loans payable to related parties, were received
from a director of the Company and others closely associated persons or 
businesses. These funds were provided as cash loans to
cover operating expenses and as payment for services provided.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:

made up of principal amounting to $3,660 and accrued interest of 
$1,283&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:

&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:

totaled $37,230; made up of principal amounting to $32,639 and accrued interest 
amounting to $ 4,591&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
justify"&gt;In aggregate, Loans Payable Related Parties
to March 31, 2013 totaled $42,173 made up of $36,299 for principal and $5,874 
for accrued interest.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align:

        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Number of shares of stock issued as of the balance sheet 
date, including shares that had been issued and were previously outstanding but 
which are now held in the treasury.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br> 
-Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br> -Topic 505<br><br> -SubTopic 
10<br><br> -Section 50<br><br> -Paragraph 2<br><br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6928386&amp;loc=d3e21463-
112644<br><br><br><br></p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ Details</a><div style="display: none;">
                <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
                  <tr>

                  </tr>

                    <td>us-gaap_</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Data Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>xbrli:sharesItemType</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Balance Type:</strong></td>

        <th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2">
          <div style="width: 200px;"><strong>SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING
